title.narrative: Diakonia - HR and Governance Program fas II
Diakonia - HR and Governance Program phase II

description.narrative:
Detta är den andra fasen av Demokrati och Mänskliga Rättigheter-programmet, planerat att genomföras mellan den 1 juli 2018 till den 30 juni 2021. Budgeten planeras till 75 MSEK. Den första fasen genomfördes mellan 1 juli 2015 till den 31 juli 2018, efter en förlängning (no-cost) från det ursprungliga planerade slutdatumet vid 2017 års slut. Förlängningen orsakades huvudsakligen av val och omval 2017 vilka orsakade att implementeringen tog längre tid än planerat. Programmet kommer att fortsätta arbetet som påbörjades under den första fasen. Resultat från den utvärdering som genomfördes i slutet av 2017 har använts för att förändra programmet och en ny partner inkluderas. Fler counties (län) och nya komponenter införlivas, bl.a. engagemang i the Kenya we want och Building bridges-initiativen.
Programmet kom ursprungligen till för att komplettera ambassadens institutionella stöd i Kenya mot samma mål genom civilsamhällets engagemang. Trots att vissa av ambassadens stöd har upphört (polisen) har Diakonia valt att fortsätta ansträngningarna som man lade ner i första fasen, för att bygga på det man uppnått under fas I. Baserat på de svårigheter som rådde i arbetet med institutionsstödet till polisen, kopplat till det alltjämt centrala behoven av att reformera polisen, stöder ambassaden valet att inkludera detta i fas II av programmet.
Programmet har två huvudresultat: 1. 'Strengthened accountability and independence of governance structures and institutions at local and national level', med fem underliggande resultat. Fokus ligger på ansvarstagarna. 2.'Inclusive, cohesive and accountable society through increased citizen engagement in governance process.' Det andra resultatet har tre underliggande resultat och fukuserar på rättighetsinnehavarna.
Vad gäller ansvarstagarna i programmet, kommer man, som nämnts, fortsätta arbeta med polisen, främst genom att stärka närpolisens kommitteer och s.k. Community Policing Forums på polisstationsnivå. Inom rättssystemet fortsätter man implementeringen av alternativa rättssystem, driver på implementering av policies som etablerades under fas I. Riksåklagaren och kriminalvården kommer att få kapacitetsstöd. De oberoende nationella kommissionerna kommer att stärkas som en del av tillhandahållande av tjänster för medborgarna i det fortsatta förändringsarbetet.
För rättighetsinnehavarna kommer programmet att stärka deltagande på länsnivå, liksom stödja medborgarna att hålla ansvariga till svars, liksom att begära förbättringar vad gäller den ekonomiska förvaltningen och tjänster som de har rätt att åtnjuta. Civilsamhället kommer också att stödjas att fortsätta sitt påverkansarbete för ett gynnsamt klimat för civilt manöverutrymme. Följden av 2017 års val blev ett alltmer polariserat land och programmet kommer adressera behovet av sammanhållning genom att bygga på det nationella initiativet the "Kenya we want" och främja dialog för att ena landet.
Diakonia är en organisation baserad på kristna värderinga som arbetar med runt 350 organisationer i 25 länder. Organisationen ämnar att arbeta för en rättivs, jämlik och varaktigt förändrad värld, fri från fattigdom, förtryck, ojämlikhet och våld. Diakonia utför inte egna projekt, utan stödjer lokala partnerorganisationer. Man får ekonomisk finansiering från individer och församlingar i Sverige, liksom institutionellt stöd från Sida, ambassader, EU och andra internationella organisationer.

This is the second phase of the Democracy and Human Rights Program, planned to be implemented from the 1st of July 2018 to the 30th of June 2021, with a planned budget of 75 MSEK. The first phase was carried out between the 1st of July 2015 to the 31st of July 2018, after a no cost extension from the originally planned end at the end of 2017. The no cost extension was to a large extent caused by the 2017 elections which slowed down implementation of the program. The program will continue with the work that started during the first phase, taking into account the findings of the midterm evaluation that was carried out at the end of 2017 and address those through amending and include a new partner and increase in county presence and new components; among others to engage in the Kenya we want and Building bridges initiatives.
The program came about as a way for the Embassy to complement the institutional support in Kenya with efforts towards the same through civil society engagement. Although some of the Embassy´s institutional support have ended (police), Diakonia has chosen to continue the efforts made so far on the civil society level, to leverage on gains made during phase I. Given the difficulties experienced working directly with the police, but the critical need to reform the institution, the Embassy supports the choice to include these efforts in phase II.
The program has two main outcomes: 1. 'Strengthened accountability and independence of governance structures and institutions at local and national level', with five intermediate outcomes. This outcome focuses on the duty bearers. 2.'Inclusive, cohesive and accountable society through increased citizen engagement in governance process.' The second outcome has three intermediate outcomes and is focusing on the rights holders.
On the duty bearer side the program will, as previously mentioned, continue working with the police, mainly strengthening Community Policing Committees and Community Policing Forums at the police station levels. The work with the Judiciary will continue the implementation of Alternative Justice Systems (AJS), pushing the implementation of policies that were established during the first phase. Capacity building of the Office of the Director of Public Prosecutions (ODPP) and the Prisons will continue. The work with the Independent commissions will be strengthened as parts of the supply side of the change continuum.
On the demand side, the program will strengthen public participation at county level, as well as supporting citizens to demand accountability and improvements in public financial management and service delivery. Civil society will also be supported to continue their advocacy for improved environment for civic action. The 2017 elections left an increasingly divided country behind and the program will address the need for cohesion through building on the national framework of the "Kenya we want" and foster dialogue aiming at moving the country towards reconciliation.
Diakonia is a faith-based Swedish development organisation working with around 350 local organisations in about 25 countries. The organisation aims to work for a just, equal and sustainable world free from poverty, oppression, inequality and violence. Diakonia does not carry out projects on their own, but instead supports local partner organisations. Its funding comes from donations by individuals and congregations in Sweden, as well as institutional funding from Sida, embassies, the EU and other international organisations.

The Program strives to achieve a 'Strengthened democratic culture through accountable and independent governance structures and institutions at local and national level' as well as 'Inclusive, cohesive and accountable society throught increased citizen engagement in governance processes'.

tag.narrative: 16.3 - Främja rättssäkerheten på nationell och internationell nivå samt säkerställa lika tillgång till rättvisa för alla.
16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.
16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.
5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

title.narrative: Agreement 11720 Diakoni HR Governance phase II
Agreement 2nd amendment Diakonia HR Governance Phase II
Diakonia-HR and Governance Program phase II
Decision 11720 Diakoni HR Governance phase II
Decision 2nd amendment Diakonia HR Governance phase II
Diakonia-HR and Governance Program phase II-Decision

description.narrative: Very impressive display of activities and examples of results in Diakonias reporting. For instance, extensive advocacy on LGBTIQ issues and capacity building in how to handle discrimination, violence and abuse, has led to a local reduction of stigma in coming out as queer. Media reporting, monitoring and calls for action through press statements has led to a reducion of extra judicial killings. The establishment of Kisumu Community Social Justice Center, through advocacy by partners and rights holders, has led to a process where as many as 60 per cent of issues brought to some counties where adressed by the county governments. Improved community policing structures led to improved security situation and an increase in SGBV reporting and capacity of handling of such cases. They have also increasingly worked on national cohesion and integration in relation to up coming elections through communication and disruption of negative political narratives. Diakonia and their partners are doing a lot of fantastic work related to the objectives of the programme. But it is hard to sometimes establish the connection between the activities and results, how was Diakonia involved? The overall Diakonia analysis of progress in the programme is missing and it is hard to get an overview of progress and results which makes it hard to assess the progress of the activities. Diakonia seems, however, to have been receptive to the partners needs and carried out trainings and long-term support in several areas and as part of regular follow-ups and meetings. Joint capacity building processes on gender mainstreaming was for instance identified as an area Diakonia and the partners had struggled with given its low consideration in projects. The capacity building process was then designed to address the challenges associated with lack of understanding and appreciation of gender mainstreaming. Diakonia ensured that all partners and particularly those charged with implementation as well as institutional (partner organization heads) owned the process and provided the necessary and required leadership. As a result, Diakonia has observed great appreciation as well as commitment towards gender mainstreaming through the capacity building support. Furthermore, Diakonia shows great leadership and responsibility in their role as civil society actor in Kenya. Given their excellent analysis of the state of the nation they are proactive and suggest new angles or platforms to contribute to change. Especially in regards to the upcoming elections in 2022. In conclusion, Diakonia does excellent context analysis, extensive compilation of results and display of activities and they are no doubt very updated with what and how their partners are doing. Diakonia should, however, sharpen their role as umbrella organization and link between partners and Sida and provide a progress analysis. What are the general results? What has changed due to the activities. Most results achieved or treading slowly? Areas of success? How well have they reached their target groups? Do they have the right or at least reasonable strategies/theory of change? Challenges? Is this a good result? Are they content? Is this what is reasonable to expect for the money and effort? What do the results mean? Why is this important? Relate to ToC.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
